Three of my favorite actors were difficult to watch in this truly bad movie. I laughed once and it was more of a chuckle. Don't waste your time.

Please stop using combo McCarthy/Falcone, it dont work at all. Use other people as writers cause this was torture.Spy was funny film and I kind wait sequel for that cause characters were all ready familiar and funny but no....just more stuff from dump factory McCarthy/Falcone. Please stop.

Reading the reviews on here make my day. What were you expecting this to be? Good Will Hunting? Know what the intended audience is before you watch something. Guess what? They have these super cool things called trailers. Trailers give you an idea of what a movie will be.Is this movie a classic? Hell no. It's stupid entertainment meant to take your mind off of things for a while. Stop pretending to be siskel and ebert, stop pretending that because you have the internet everyone cares what you think. Every single day I'm saddened by how stupid and selfish and unreasonably our world has become. It's so focused on being woke no one can enjoy anything anymore. This movie might not be entertaining to you, but the last thing I want to watch is another movie about some movement or sexual preference or some other PC filled snooze fest. I hope they make a bunch of these movies to drive the cool new generation away and back to tick tok or some other platform designed for those with the attention span of a gnat. In the time it took me to write this maybe some of you have thought of a new # that could be trending.Stay cool ya'll.

reviews.review_title: I don't get all the hate
reviews.content: I don't get all the hate. It was not the best movie but it wasn't bad either. It kept us all entertained and laughing together. Not every movie must be an award winning unique masterpiece. Just keep me entertained and a few good laughs. That's all we need and probably why we had family fun watching it.
Its was a fun watch for me. A lot of funny lines and great humor. The people that hate this movie must be really boring in life. It's worth watching.
It beats being near other humans or listening to the stupid news complain about Covid.

NAY I SAY!See I was expecting to laugh throughout this movie...It had its moments, but it didn't serve as a comedy film entirely,
and it didn't serve as a super hero film either,It had some rather disgusting moments,
It had some rather stupid moments,I mean the whole plot, aside from it being a supposed comedy film, was horrible.This is one of those movies where the scientist goes out into the real world and gathers his own dangerous specimens for research.Watch it if you don't have anything better to do, but don't expect this to be the better thing to do of two things.

I haven't seen a movie I liked with Melissa McCarthy, and I still haven't. The same plot as a GI Joe episode where the mayor hires Cobra to make him look good by having bad guys attack him.The good - the fact it endedThe bad - action scenes as stimulating as US tax code & twice as effective as a sleeping pill. Everything was predictable like how Melissa got her powers."Don't touch anything"
"Ok" then touches everythingThe ugly - 1 dimensional characters, humor that's as amusing as fact jokes and had less tension then a Scooby-Doo episode (the episodes with Scrapy-Doo).Avoid at all costs or play if you want to scare a burglar out of your house.

reviews.review_title: Geared to the least common denominator
reviews.content: Standard fare for McCarthy. Same ol' same ol'. Sometimes a bit funny; but the unfunny vastly outnumbers the funny.

Is a good movie with great acting and a lot of heart with friendship as the center of it all and its fun, too! The funny bits are really good I hope we get the explore the Thunder Force universe in the future :)the young actors killed it and I hope we get to more of their work in the future. Our leading ladies are as amazing as they always areGreat movie and don't mind the super bad reviews they are way over the top.

This was probably one of the worst movies I've seen in a while. I kept waiting for it to pick up but finally about 40 min in I had to turn it off. Very disappointing, not sure how something like this gets put out.

This could have been a funny film, but it got annoying quick. Ive tried to finish this movie 3 times but its soo bad that I just couldn't. You spend way too much time on their growing up years. Melissa is hilarious but you didn't let her be her. We get it the two are totally different, too much time on that. Wayyyy too much time on training. It just got tiring to watch. Alot of the scenes should have gone to deleted scenes in the special features. Needs to be recut.
Not much to say about this movie really apart from it was complete rubbish.

reviews.review_title: A great movie to watch with friends and family!
reviews.content: I loved this movie. I watched it with my best friend we thought it was really funny. I don't understand why it's getting all these bad reviews. I would definitely watch again.
Well not get that time back. Bad from start to finish! Story is weak. To much pointless chatter! Some scenes embarrassing, glad for the fast forward!!

reviews.review_title: Unfunny mess. Yes I realise it was meant to be a spoof
reviews.content: A mess, a hot mess of a movie. I sort of see what they were going for but the pacing is WAY off. Comedy is vague and superficial (at best) and feeds off Melissa's quips solely.Ben Falcone should bot be allowed to write movies; please.

reviews.review_title: A fun and fine movie to watch on a Saturday night
reviews.content: Throughout this I kept thinking that it was kind of a dumb one-joke movie, and it is.But it was perfect for a lonely Saturday night during the pandemic.One of the things I really liked about this is that it isn't overly long. I get so tired of movies that are super long. This just flew by.Meh. If you are picky or mean or a troll, you'll probably hate it. But it was fine by me.

reviews.review_title: My Gawd! McCarthy's movies have gone from bad to horrendous!
reviews.content:
What a waste of 1hour and 40 minutes... most of the movie was absolutely nauseating with every food scene and there were too many....
And the wasted time on that ridiculous Andy/Andrew naming thing...
The script sucked, the characters sucked, the plot was ridiculous...and all I can ask is when will this usually talented cast actually produce something of substance?Such a disappointment...

2020-2021 has been a tough year. And if you, like me want a little more joy in your life, then watch this movie. Mellisa and Octavia bring silly unadulterated joy and humour. I'd be liking if I said it was a cinematic masterpiece, but I don't think for a single second it's supposed to be, finally a movie that doesn't take itself too seriously and just allowed itself to be fun! 10/10.

I realize that Melissa McCarthy is funny and talented, but her husband Ben Falcone needs to quit riding her coattails. Every collaboration between those 2 results in utter garbage. Don't waste the time on this.
Gave up watching after an hour as it was truly bad.
Ok yes yes it was stupid, trashy and entertaining. It's not Marvel or DC just take it for what it is DAFT FUN. People have really lost their sense of humour these days.

reviews.review_title: Does what it says on the tin.
reviews.content: It's not great but why would anyone expect a masterpiece. Its easy to follow and you don't have to think. Sometimes you want that from a film. Probably wouldn't watch it again but I needed something to unwind with and this did the job.

You dont need a decent script, or an engaging story and which fool thinks that a film needs a start, middle and end ?????This is funny because apparently all you need to carry a film is these two.So my full, honest albeit lengthy review - WOW its hilarious because they are F*t.Chri*t its bad.
We enjoyed watching this as a family. It's not rocket science, it's just stupid humor. We laughed and enjoyed all the characters!!

I'm not into superhero movies as a general rule but this was fun.It's deserves more than 4-5 stars.I love the bit with the car. That car looks very low!It was good to watch a film with so many women in it.Maybe that's why it has a low score?
I really don't understand the purpose of Netflix in investing millions in this movie, I know that the public needs to be entertained and new ideas are needed but please this is a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Mallissa is usually very funny... not this time.
reviews.content: Bland, boring, and to be quite frank only one good laugh.

reviews.review_title: Melissa, we're glad you're happily married--but hubby is a TERRIBLE writer/director
reviews.content: I groan anytime I see Ben Falcone doing anything more than a cameo on a film.This was so unfunny, so miscast, such a waste of time. Wasn't it just months ago that Melissa and Bobby Cannavale were in SUPERINTELLIGENCE together?I hear that Melissa and Olivia Spencer are life-long friends....sorry, that does not into a credible friendship on screen, and Olivia is Just Not Funny. There was ONE GOOD SCENE, with Em's grandmother, but that's about the only time during the film when I truly LAUGHED.Truly awful.

reviews.review_title: THE worst superhero movie I have ever seen.
reviews.content: Worse than Justice League, Green Lantern, Steel and the 1990 Captain America.It's like Melissa called in favors from friends and didn't let them see any of the script except the scenes they were in to hide the rotting pile of garbage this film is.
What a waste of talents! Good casting but bad writers! I didn't get one single good laugh out of it!

reviews.review_title: Why are movies so bad nowadays, honest question...
reviews.content: Listen, I am all for watching movies for entertainment, and sometimes they exceed that, but this movie and plenty like it makes me question, what happened? Not even excited anymore when new movies are advertised, they will all disappoint. The lead actress (Melissa) has had some good moments in her career, but this is not one of them. I hope some will enjoy this movie, but I will not be one of them.

reviews.review_title: It's the same as every other generic CGI-fest movie that comes out of Hollywood every week
reviews.content: Really, there's nothing special here. Thunder thighs: a chubster story is just another movie in the ocean of bad ones that tries to aim for the lowest common denominator in order to bring some bucks for the studio behind it, while it also shamelessly tries to capitalize on the Superhero name that has seen better days.It doesn't have a clear vision - hell, it doesn't have any at all. The pacing of it is all over the place. The story is cliched, weak, it lacks a strong direction. The jokes most of the time fall flat - most of the time they do not work or feel inappropriate and fat. Also the movie's tone is quite inconsistent, while the actors don't really do a convincing job portraying their characters either. I mean they are huge.This movie sums up perfectly what Netflix has become. What once was the holy grail of pop-culture and a shining beacon of hope that showed how mass-appealing movies can carry just as important messages as art-house movies and dramas and be available commercial free, turned into something that's anything but reminiscent of an entertainment channel. It feels like a 4 days old dry burger from a fast-food restaurant that was half chewed and then eaten by the two main actresses.

This is such a terrible, predictable, boring film. Pretty much everything you expect when you start watching a Melissa McCarthy movie, the one upside is Jason Batemans Crab Man, he's kind of funny. If you want a better experience just search up a compilation of all the Crab Man parts on YouTube, you'll laugh just as much as if you watched the actual film and it'll be way quicker.

You had a good idea, great actors, and good special effects
and it was ruined by bad lines and scenes, introduction and development of characters
and the news scenes!! Come on it was like a in game storyline cheap scenes
you had a good idea and ruined it by the scenario and direction.

I thought maybe the movie had low ratings because of people automatically downvoting female lead movies. But no. It deserves the low ratings. I don't know why the writer feels the humor must be crass and disgusting in order to be funny. Because it is not. The whole plot is lazy and unimaginative. The dialogues are boring and stupid. I think Ben Falcone should find another line of work.

Y. Jason Bateman's Crab has the most potential and the weird sex game is probably where the movie generates its best comedy. In the end, I chuckled a little but this is not that good. Falcone's work continues to be flawed and the great cast struggles against it.

Twenty years in and it's still possible for a movie to come along and be so awful that it grabs the title of worst of the "new" century. Some challenge to overcome and watching this unfunny mess. If I didn't know better I'd say this movie was just recycling the same formula as McCarthy's earlier and more successful movies. She plays yet another brush abrasive and idiotic typical straight line character. This movie was painful to endure. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE.

Watch the previews and you know what's coming. I laughed a bunch of times and isn't that what a comedy is for? The super low ratings are ridiculous. Nobody is expecting a classic comedy but the Trolls just want to hate. It seems you have to scroll last the first 30 reviews anymore to get an honest review. Sad.
Oh come on there were parts of this had me in stitches. Ok it wasn't brilliant but I've watched a lot lot worse. Very watchable Sunday afternoon fun.

It's not Citizen Kane, and if you're expecting Citizen Kane you're expectations are simply too high.If you're in the mood for low brow comedy and a silly sci-fi story, this movie might just be a 10/10.I think movies should be rated against similar movies of the same genre/sub-genre, and the dramatically low ratings here should be reconsidered from that perspective. This movie is not a masterpiece by any stretch but, if you're in the mood for it, it is highly enjoyable.

Goofy movie and for the most part too goofy. Reminds me of the 90'ties Batman movies also way too goofy and nippel suit. Also why are alle the good/smart guys women and all the bad/stupid ones men?( Except for laser obviously).

Will someone please tell Falcone to stop making movies!! He and Melissa are dumbing down the comedy drama ala Adam Sandler. Don't waste your time. Rewatch Jack and Jill if you need a reminder on what is wrong with comedies in Hollyweird these days.

I should have known I would detest this film. It is directed by Ben Falcone who has horrific failures with every film. The Boss was the best of the bunch and that is because of Melissa McCarthy. But for some reason she insists in being in his messes. I think it is destroying her credibility. Octavia Spenser is wasted in this awful thing.

I recently suffered a death in the family which was funnier than this movie.The old ball and chain and I were ready for a silly, funny film but this film was dog poo.No real story, no real laughs, just give it a miss and watch Bridesmaids instead.Jason Bateman - Why are you filming this garbage when you should be working on Ozark!!!!I am going to recommend this film to all the people I hate. Haha Screw them!

reviews.review_title: You got what it is...nothing less...nothing more
reviews.content: If you are aware that a movie is a sci-fi, cartoon type movie and it is not your thing then don't watch it. You got exactly what you tuned in for and a lot of movies of that type tend to be mediocre.I believe most people watch Melissa's movies of late and expect the old talented Melissa we all know and love. That's long gone. Since Ben Falcone took over and writes and directs all her movies, and he is an extremely untalented individual, we are now seeing a new Melissa McCarthy. Yes, he has destroyed her career just as John Krasinski is chipping away at Emily Blunt's talent.Message for Ben and John...stay home, mind the children and allow true talent to flourish and bloom.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the whiny dudes
reviews.content: This movie is funny, family-friendly and a unique take on superhero tropes. Reminded me a bit of Sky High. The humor is great and plays nicely off the lead actress's personalities.It's not surprising that if a movie features multiple female leads, the red pill weirdos come out of the woodwork to dogpile low ratings. If you don't want to watch, stick to hentai and Ben Shapiro YouTube videos.

So sick of horrible McCarthy movies... Spencer has ruined her reputation for great roles, but it's kind of sad that Jason Bateman decided to be a part of this, he usually makes good choices. We've heard this story before in many different ways, the storyline is just preschool level. Sorry I wasted my time.

I watched this one with the kids and we really enjoyed it! It's not a big budget Marvel type superhero movie, it's just a fun little comedy that happens to involve superheroes. Octavia and Melissa are always great and entertaining, so if you enjoy their movies this one is worth a watch.

I legitamely said to myself "don't watch this movie" The wife said let's have a drink and watch this movie.... I will never let my wife make a decision for us again... After choosing this movie she is banned from all future choices.

Melissa, as always, On her eternal Part of A disgusting person. The rest of the movie and Cast is Superior. The Action movie was not bad. If a Melissa movie is included on the channel you are paying is ok to watch. Never pay for a Melissa fatcarty movie. She is always awful acting with her eternal part, no matter what genre the movie is.

reviews.review_title: It is not even funny to watch this burn
reviews.content:
Some movies are made for ridicule, others to laugh at, and some, like this turd, are so awful that you only feel numb.I mean there was a time when Melissa McCarthy was a guarantee for a chuckle while you did shots to her bad dialogue, shots to her bad acting, and horrible attempts to be funny. Apparently we cannot even have that anymore, her movies are getting so bad they are not even c-level.You want to waste your money, create a urine soaked dumpster of a movie while people are laughing behind your back? Hire Melissa McCarthy.I know she can be funny, I actually enjoyed Spy, but something has just gone wrong along the way and I am uncertain if its her own bad taste in scripts or Hollywood just trying to force us this overweight feminist whether she is in good or bad movies.Well, one of the leads aside, she is not the only thing that stinks around this movie. Octavia is almost as bad, and all the side characters and the supposed protagonist are so bad it is not even funny.But of course, as with most bad movies, it does not stop with bad acting or bad writing or bad casting choices, nope, it all suck. Light, CGi, music, clothes, story, every single bit and piece of this movie is so horrible I kept shaking my head and wondering if I have ever seen anything worse.I have by the way, seen worse that is. But not many...This is a very strong contender for the worst movie of the year award. I give this a 2/10 because I feel nice and although everything stinks and everything about this movie is awful, it is at least consistent and I at least feel like they tried...
uhm...I know, I know, I am just trying to be as positive I can be....Do not see this. Seriously, it gives nothing but numbness.

reviews.review_title: I'd rather watch a Neil Breen movie
reviews.content: I'd give zero stars if I could. It was incredibly boring & unfunny. I'd rather watch Fateful Findings any Neil Breen movie over this. Breen movies shouldn't even exist they're so bad but I at least laugh at those.Octavia Spencer is such a good actress. I hate seeing talented actors waste their time on this type of garbage.

Has to be of the superhero kind, then this might suit you as on that upfronts female strenght and ultimate power. Some might say its just a cover up feminist stunt that only suits the taste of a female audience.The grumpy old man though dribbled like a great dane, looking at miss chibby, chubby and chobby, in the most skinclad outfits (made by armani?) on the market, who becomes step by step the wisest, strongest and the invisibilest of its kind doing crimefight in their best fashion of tge trade. I shall not elaborate what might be the sexiest creatures on the silver screen might be, but these 3 do get a high rank from myself, remember a wellfilled hip is a natural protection itself.tgom treads deep water here so...story and plot are completely free from originality, but the comedy, good and witty comments, and very good stunt standins for the 3 musketties saves the glory of a 5 stars. So open your dopamine locks and let the joy of funny women surround yourself.A little recommend.

I read that the two leads have been friends for years, close friends even. For a movie about 2 friends that rekindled their childhood friendship and apparently are back to being besties, it just wasnt that believable. I didn't see/ feel the chemistry between two people that are actually good friends in real life. That made it kinda hard. I like both actresses in other movies, but they just didn't do this justice. It had its rare funny moments, but very rare.

So many bad reviews! I for one thoroughly enjoyed this one. It was weird, it was offbeat and just strange. I laughed and found myself smiling often. Overall a solid comedy that I expect will gain momentum over time.

Ok... this is not a movie I would want to see in the cinema, but it is a light and silly comedy with enjoyable characters and not much to digest mentally or emotionally. It's one of those movies you watch on a plane or when you want something light and goofy. Don't try to read too much into it or you will be disappointed. Take it for what it is and have fun.

reviews.review_title: Why ? Couldn't find a better way to spend what it cost to make this garbage
reviews.content: Melissa McCarthy and Octavia Spencer need to fire their agents- its's awful and it's boring, and its not funny and it's awful- did I say that already? It's awful.
It's a Melissa McCarthy movie, what do you expect? This and the puppets is as good as it gets for her movies. Smoke some weed and relax.
This is so bad..... just don't waste your time. It's so extra lol.

reviews.review_title: *** SPOILERS *** McCarthy can do better than this!
reviews.content: I'm not going to spend much time on this review because there's not much to say about this movie that is remotely good. It felt like I was watching something that was the making of cult classic, then turned into a dour chore to sit through that required more execution to pull off and didn't deliver. McCarthy has an oath to her beloved husband, but that doesn't mean she should be dragged down with him for creating such a bland film.For the most part the acting was sub-par and phoned in by most of the cast. It's as if they knew what they were a part of, and the check was coming in so what right? And that's pretty much what I can sum up about the movie as a whole. Nothing more than actors walking through the film from plot point to plot point with no execution of comedic moments that land its desired target. McCarthy did her best at improve but the script didn't do her favors and it showed a lot throughout. Oscar winner Octavia Spencer seemed to be here by name recognition alone as if she owed McCarthy a favor and sometimes when you watch her performance in this film, you can almost see it. Sad really.All in all, this film did get 4/10 stars from me on the soul reason that it did somewhat take itself seriously even with such a ridiculous concept and rift on the superhero genre. It reminded of a 90's superhero films in the same vein of Blank Man, Meteor Man, Star Kid, Doctor Mordrid, Mystery Men, Steel, Generation X, Black Scorpion, Barb Wire, and Tank Girl. Will Thunder force grow a cult following such as these films have over the years? Only time will tell, and that's where I'll leave this on a positive note, but saying that, Ms. McCarthy Falcone can do better than this...Much better. 4/10.
The movie feeds you crap and expect nobody will notice. No need to point out wasted talent, did they really read the script.
Seemed like a good premise, with a terrific cast, but was pointless and really boring. Awful script and inane dialogue. The cast couldn't save this one!

To be honest I was skeptical about watching this movie. Turns out I got a big kick out of it! I love Melissa McCarthy and Jason Bateman together anyhow. Octavia Spencer is awesome, too! The humor is sort of Austin Powers-like, in my opinion.

One of the worst super hero movies of all time. Let's take a lady that just played a sweet old grandma and try to make her an action hero with zero athletic ability. McCarthy at least look she could move. Octavia struggled to just get up in several of the scenes. Get in some sort of shape before doing an action comedy. At least be able to get out of a chair or off the floor without struggling.

We had a good time watching this. Personally I find it hard these days finding a descent comedy, that is not all smooched up with sugar candy and what not. A comedy without all the drama and romance. But this was a leap back to the comedy section. And that made us feel good.Sure, there are annoying scenes and jokes here and there. But also some very good ones. Maybe a few a lot of people don't get the meaning of, too bad. I laughed a few times and it was pretty good actually. Braindead without a doubt, but sometimes that's just what the doc ordered.In my honest opinion this is a 6.5 movie, worth a watch one night you are feeling a bit silly and just want some good old stupid comedy fun.PS! I think this pandemic has given us too much spare time and made a lot of us unhappy with everything we watch on TV. Lighten up, forget about our sucky lives for 90 minutes. It feels good!

reviews.review_title: Is this movie worth watching? Quick Answer: No.
reviews.content: Long Answer: Definitely not. You don't have to read this review because it's just not worth it.First of all, Melissa McCarthy's character (I'm too lazy to call her by her name so we'll call her Melissa) tries to pull of the "village idiot" stunt in the most embarassing way, and comes off selfish and almost bully-like to Octavia Spencer's character. She also makes fun of nerds/ "smart" people, even to Octavia's daughter which is a really boring and overused trope. At some point she even feels entitled to know about Octavia's life (such as the existence of her daughter) even though Melissa was the one who cut Octavia off.The "jokes" in this movie are objectively unfunny, and run off for far too long. One example is a joke near the beginning of the movie between Melissa and some cafe owner who she's friends with, and the cafe guy makes a weird error in his speech and he keeps trying to make joke after joke about it, but it just comes off so awkward. Not to mention the "dweebish" character that is supposedly a victim of Melissa's bullying. He purposely fails at comedy, but it just doesn't make him any better. The only good gag in this movie we get is when Octavia's character gets the easier treatment while Melissa gets the painful treatment. But they can't even get that right because Octavia immediately gets a hold of her powers and that's it.The logic and plot in this movie is frustrating. The villian is PAINFULLY obvious, I even got the double crosser on the first try. If you decide to watch the movie, I don't even have to spoil it for you because it's just that obvious. Also, every single person in this movie is hilariously not smart, even though there are 2 smart characters in this movie. No one bothers to get decent security to keep Melissa from getting poweres, the bad guys miss the good guys even though they could totally just kill them, and oh gosh the ending which I'll get to after the next part.My least favorite part of the movie is the raw chicken bit and crab man! Melissa has to fight against a crab man robber and just flirts with him? Also he goes "you can't kill us, that would make you bad!" as if arrest wasn't an option. But yeah, Melissa just uses the seduction technique. Later on they both confess that they like raw chicken and, oh gosh, that's sort of where the ending ties in!The ending is meh. The villain wants to blow up a building cool, but then the two girls just rush in and wowsers, they nearly lose until Octavia's "nerdy" (thanks for that Melissa) daughter suddenly gets super speed and helps! Melissa tosses the villain and the last threat they have is a bomb. The daughter offers to run with the bomb so it doesn't blow up the building but apparently it's not "stable". Ok? Then Melissa just offers to do it. But one important thing she says before that is "We can't just throw it out the window, it'll hurt people!". Think really carefully, then throw your thoughts out the window because they aren't needed here. Melissa jumps out the WINDOW with the BOMB. See the problem? Also not to mention there was a large body of water outside of the window, the effect would've been the same!!! I really thought the ending was bad until...The crab man and Melissa start feeding each other raw chicken, mouth to mouth. I think I'm not gonna eat crab or chicken for like until I forget this movie exists, which should take about a week. Anyways if you thought you wanted to see this movie, good for you but I thought the same thing and I was completely wrong.

reviews.review_title: I was keen for a good laugh...
reviews.content: I think I spent 80% cringing and the rest just confused how this got green lit in the first place....How are these actors/ actresses/ directors getting money to produce this rubbish? It's getting out of hand now.
Not the best and not the worst, but definitely fun! Doesn't deserve such bad reviews. It'll make you laugh and that's what matters!
I enjoyed it, The storyline was great and the characters were funny. Ignore the bad reviews and give it a shot, you wont regret it!
Lighten up people. It's not supposed to be life changing. Just some cheesy fun. Jason Bateman's crab role alone makes this worth watching.
Not as bad as the ratings implied...its good for a few laughs..a fun family movie..

I think many reviewers missed the point of this movie. It seemed clear to me that it was not a superhero movie; it was a spoof on superhero movies. I found it an enjoyable movie to watch. No, it wasn't terribly funny, but I wouldn't call it "unfunny." The elements were really quite clever if you understand classic comic book villains and superheroes. I did find humor in reviews from those who actually seemed pissed of Netflix even made this movie.Disclainer- Not a paid reviewer for Netflix, producers, directors, or actors associated with this film.

reviews.review_title: Melissa McCarthy as a superhero is ridiculous - sadly not funny at all
reviews.content: Netflix's original movie "Thunder Force" is set in a world where supervillains are commonplace, but no heroes. Then two estranged childhood best friends reunite after one devises a treatment that gives them both powers to protect the city. Ben Falcone should stop making movies for his wife Melissa McCarthy. This whole experience is so humorless that it was seemingly written by a 13-year old, who hates everything funny. Even McCarthy herself is hardly trying here and that is saying a lot about the whole production. Yes, it looks very good, but it has almost no substance whatsoever. It made me sad how little Octavia Spencer wanted to be in this movie and you can tell it right away - she just wanted that check. We know McCarthy has talent and she can do better. So please start doing better - a lot better.

This was light hearted and funny. I can listen to Melissa McCarthy talk all day long. Jason Bateman and his crab arms?? Octavia as the straight guy? Her cute kid added to the mix. It was good.It's painful to read these reviews. Come on. You should know going in what you are watching. That is what Trailers are for! And you do not have to continue watching a movie you don't like. Imagine that! No need to put it on 1.5 speed. And those 2 hours you lost? They are going to be gone anyway.I really don't believe half these people even watched this movie. Everyone on here sounds miserable. Give it the 4 or 5 it deserves and stop with the ones. And sorry but just because you don't like Ben Falcone movies does not mean Hollywood has to stop greenlighting them lol. Funniest thing I have read all day.
I don't understand the awful and harsh reviews at all. My husband and I loved this movie. It made us laugh a lot.
One of the worst pieces of trash I've ever seen.One of the worst pieces of trash I've ever seen.One of the worst pieces of trash I've ever seen.One of the worst pieces of trash I've ever seen.

reviews.review_title: We should stop giving money to Ben Falcone
reviews.content: He's directing her movies now, and the only reason she probably takes his role, it's because he is her husband and she doesn't want to hurt his poor little heart. The movie is as awful as you think, and an absolute waste of Melissa McCarthy's talent (yes, I believe that she can be pretty funny sometimes). The only redeeming quality of the movie is Jason Bateman as the Crabman. Easily the worst film of 2021.
Saw a lot of bad ratings herebut disagree with them. Sure the plot was kind of silly and had some holes, but overall it was a lot of fun. And we need fun.
I really like Melissa McCarthy. I really enjoyed this film. If you're a fan & enjoy comedies, watch this.

I couldn't even finish half the film...Is it only me who thinks Melissa Mccarthy isn't funny? I have no idea at what angle she's coming at with these scripts. Shes either really bad at acting or amazing and I'm not getting it.

It's a steaming pile of Falcone/McCarthy _____.Seriously this is god awful and I'm shocked that Bateman (that is the worst character ever thought up) or Octavia Spencer couldn't even breathe life into their characters. Octavia freaking Spencer for gods sake! I didn't think there would come a time I wouldn't like anything that golden nugget did but I was proven wrong today. The dialogue through most of this is delivered with zero enthusiasm, like they knew what they were doing was just that bad.Not sorry, this is just bad. Falcone and McCarthy please stop the husband/wife working together thing, take a breather from each other and work with some other taken out there in filmland cause the quality of your last few husband/wife projects have steadily declined down to this last pile of ______.

I'm not sure exactly when they began filming this movie, but it's quite evident that this was made during the Covid era, which at least explains some of its downfall. During the first third of the movie, characters are seen standing 10 feet apart from each other for entire scenes, including a reunion moment when the main characters are supposed to be seeing each other for the first time in 20 years. Lack of physical interaction / touching is also pretty noticable. I can commend the cast and crew for trying to get work done in the midst of a pandemic, but unfortunately the script itself is ultra lacking.The characters are one dimensional, and two of the main villains have a severe lack of motive and seem to both just have an inexplicable fetish for "killing people." What an innovative concept for a baddie. Meanwhile, Michelle McCarthy is using super strength to fight off bad guys while Octavia Spencer turns invisible and hides...she does almost nothing the entire movie. Neither does Jason Bateman, whom I love, but whose super power is...crab arms? And he participates in fights by literally...clipping his claws and sideways crab-walking away? And he somehow used this talent to make it into the elite inner circle of the bad guys?Aside from a few laughable moments, most of the script and comedy was gimmicky and predictable. I felt like I was reading the first draft of a script (which again, maybe was because it was all they could do to get content made during COVID, but unfortunately...it's a bit of a fail.) If you watch it, watch it with a friend you can verbally dissect the movie with as a laugh.

I really enjoyed this movie. The structure was good, it was easy to understand. Just some light hearted humor that's not something to be taken too seriously. I think it's all about personal preference. No reason to get dogmatic in the reviews 😂

I had a few fun chuckles. Melissa always delivers with those. Is it a great story? No. Is it terrible? No! You get exactly what you expect: a fun little ride to get your mind off the crazy of the world.
Cant even write a review, waste of talents. They might have had fun making it, but it didn't make any sense and was boring. ....next.

reviews.review_title: I've never given a film 1 star before!
reviews.content: I put this on for my nephews so I could play card games with the other adults and ended up watching it in the corner of my eye because I had zero idea what the hell was going on. This movie is cheesy, it's tacky and it is a really bad representation of some amazing actors that must have been paid with dignity or something. Octavia why would you lend your talents to this film!!!!Seriously, it was so cheesy I had to take a Lacteaze. Don't do it.

Imagine you are on a plane that is about to crash right after take-off. Then out it the blue Jason Bateman shows up to avoid catastrophe and a fiery explosion. The plane still crashes but there are survivors. That was this movie; saved from complete failure thanks to Bateman. It is a super hero comedy with the most stale gags or jokes that try way too hard. Enter scene right Jason Bateman who smoothes out the coarse dialog with a few slick and subtle zingers to salvage a story about two old friends; one a wildly successful scientist and one just a normal twit. The twit idiotically interferes with the science experiment, which begins to grant her super strength, and was not intended to be used on her. The experiment was designed to help stop super villains by giving super powers to a regular person. One super villain is Bateman who has humongous lobster claws for arms. Anyway, can this experiment gone awry actually end up as a success? Watch it if you must but you'll just keep wishing Bateman and "Arrested Development" were never cancelled.
This film actually started okay, but rapidly it went down hill! Once I saw Jason Bateman wearing crab claws, I was done! Please don't waste your time watching it.. not a single part of it is funny!

A good, fun, nothing-complex-here movie.Plot is super predictable, with a few genuinely funny scenes.Melissa McCarthy being ... Melissa McCarthy - funny, self-deprecating.I enjoyed it. Ignore the haters here.

Believe me or not, you will get lost easily in the first 30min.I couldn't understand why the characters are doing that, what they are doing. Everything is just a mess. After watching the first fight between the Thunder Force and the bad guys, I didn't know why the bag guys leaving unexpectedly and bla bla. I just gave up after that.Simply put, don't waste time to watch this movie.

All i can say is dont see it, i had hopes the reviews was wrong still when i saw Melissa McCarthy on the front i had a little bit of hope, but the reviews dont even come close on how bad! This movie is!
Enjoyable. Silly hilarious jokes and funny. Worth watching. Still better than Wonder Woman 1984.

This could have been so good! Great talent! Great concept! But why did they have to settle for crass and crude? It just stunts any character development and limits the audience. I give this film a 5 (disappointing) out of 10 {Superhero Comedy}
This took a while to get going but had some good moments.Felt stiff at times and over acted a little bit all in all I found it enjoyable.
I thought it will be funny... I am very disappointed because I think they were trying to make it funny but it turns out to be the worst funny movie ever (?)

Funniest movie I've seen all day XD.Hi, how are you?Lol. This movie is funny. Goofy funny. Me's'n no usually liken a goofy funny, maybe because it's usually done pretentiously, but this goofiness is sincere. Maybe. Hopefully. Maybe because instead of being made by easily amused folks trying to make themselves laugh like peekaboo makes babies laugh, it's made by people who have also bored of that, and went past it, looking for new amusements on that path.Or maybe revisiting how we used to be. I remember when the closet was a thing, a lot of ambiguously gay comedians built their entire act around beating around the bush about how gay they might or might not be. Individual opinions vary, but societally, that was part of our culture. I only speak for the era I was actually alive during, but, it wasn't illegal, and it was edgy, it was great, people enjoyed the humor, even if they didn't partake in the activity, and maybe it was kind of disarming to the people who didn't approve of the activity. But you know, when people got overly sensitive, offended and preachy about it, that swings the pendulum on the other side, and it's not funny anymore, it's just something to be hostile about. Preaching belongs behind a pulpit, so we can, you know, we can make sure to not go there and subject ourselves to it. But when the preaching is in a movie, that brings the fight to us, and we weren't trying to fight, we were just trying to watch a movie. Point is, there's a gay joke in this movie. More of a gag, really, with jokes around it. Not pushy or pully, it's just there, being what it is. Which makes me think that maybe people are starting to calm down about that. That's good. Great. I'd like to see funny be funny and jokes be jokes, and let movies be movies again, like it used to be.The Crab-Man is hilarious, lol. Mallory Keaton's brother with pincers, lol. XD.

reviews.review_title: Am I the only one in the world that liked this movie?
reviews.content: I liked it! I was reading these reviews and I think I'm the only one that liked it. I figured I would leave this review so everyone can down vote me for being unhelpful! Welcome to 2021 where nobody is ever happy!

reviews.review_title: These other reviewers must have no sense of humor...
reviews.content: I absolutely loved this movie. My 15yo daughter and I was cracking up the whole time. Love films like this I can watch with my kids.

reviews.review_title: Has funny moments,all in all boring
reviews.content: It isnt really exciting,and its average. The actors are great, but its directed terribly.

reviews.review_title: Boring with an Infrequent Touch of Humour
reviews.content: This appealing action-comedy starring Melissa McCarthy and Octavia Spencer overshadows its extremely infrequent and talented jokes with a superhero borefest! Thunder Force is another let-down of a movie in which you'll see all the extremely witty, imaginative and undeniably hilarious moments in the trailers and clips, but it feels like a cheat.McCarthy and Spencer are the superheroes in this movie, but they're mainly the superheroes OF the movie. Other than the idea of how the fantasy abilities are transformed into them and the action they deliver as they fight the villains, the plot is completely aimless, pointless and terribly boring. The material is only infrequently fun and amusing.Now, Thunder Force may be tediously dull, but writer and director Ben Falcone is able to build a jolly action duo. His creation of them, alongside the performances of the actresses, are actually decent. The film's story is the aspect that left viewers in disappointment with the lack of excitement.If you liked this review, check out the full review and other reviews at aussieboyreviews.

reviews.review_title: A kids movie to be reviewed as so
reviews.content:
Initially I thought 'oh dear' about this movie, but then hang on.....this is a kids (under 13 years) movie that I chose to watch, and I did so because I like the main actresses.It also appears that other adults here are reviewing this movie, so give it a break as its not made for YOU!!!I am not sure what folks think is good quality, suitable or correct for young kids to watch these days but in my observation at age 10 they are watching 'Hunger Games' and look to 'Katnes' as a role model. When I was a kid the 'Ghostbusters' movie was in! We never had all the things kids enjoy today.So yes please remember this is A KIDS MOVIE!There are a few cliches in the storyline, but the movie is based around friendship and acceptance for one and another. If you think that showing that you don't need to be thin and look like a waif model to be successful and a superhero then your missing the point!I thought the characters did have some funny lines and I kinda enjoyed a few silly moments in this movie, and I watched the whole movie. I probably didn't need to LOLIt's hard to please these days but you could watch this on TV with your 8 year old and not worry. However, generally Thunder Force is rated PG-13 and only because they they chose to imply strong language.Just to note;
The movie 'Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them', which is classified as age 12, shows graphic child abuse as well as violent deaths. Victims are shown in great detail as ashy grey corpses.At the end of the day 'Thunder Force' offers the message that superheroes can come in all shapes, sizes, educational levels, and genders -- and that honesty and integrity win out over lying, cheating, and scaring or hurting people.

This is the most dull superhero movie I have ever seen. Melissa McCarthy needs to pick her roles more carefully. With Ghostbusters and now this dud under her belt, her star is dimming. She's not all to blame though, on top of weak writing, low budget, and a terrible performance by Octavia Spencer, she could only do so much. Melissa did her best, Bateman was entertaining, and Pom Klementieff stood out as having the most gusto for her role. Octavia continuously killed all the story's energy with every line of her near-monotone delivery of dialogue. Melissa can do much better and I hope so in her next movie. This one isn't worth seeing.
Don't waste your time. I was hoping it would be better with Octavia in it . I couldn't wait for it to be over with.
What in the world is Octavia Spencer doing in this sorry excuse for entertainment.

reviews.review_title: No--if her husband really loves her...
reviews.content: ....he'll just stop, STOP. She's given you enough chances, what is this, like the fourth crappy movie he has written/directed, etc, and had her star in? Do something on your own and stop USING your wife. If you can't write a successful movie without her, then time to give it up BUT STOP bringing your wife down. Shame, shame. Bless you Melissa, but you have to find a good movie and redeem yourself before your fans give up on you. We can only continue to support you for so long. At least do two movies of quality in between the "hubby favors." Xoxo.
Sometimes I have a guilty pleasure of watching silly movies for a few laughs. However this was a goofy movie with zero comedy. Not 1 laugh, how is that even possible. Melissa needs to retire.

reviews.review_title: Great Cast Bad Script and Jokes
reviews.content: Not worth a watch. Octavia, Jenny, Jason and all the other actors acted well, it's just a variety of other things that don't work in a big way.

REVIEW - THUNDER FORCESome cosmic radiation hits earth and gives super powers to people with a certain trait, a criminal trait.During an attack the parents of one of our heroines get killed and she vows to find a way to turn normal people into super heroes to fight back.A few and only a very few funny moments in this otherwise truly terrible film.Mellisa Mcarthy is just Mellisa Mcarthy and do I honestly need to say anymore.Story terrible, acting terrible and why oh why the dance sequence!Rating 4 out of 10.
Made for kids under 10 years of age. Flat and predicate dumb humour and the story does not excite or grabs one's attention.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst things i have ever seen
reviews.content: I don't have much good to say about this movie. It has a high budget so some of the things such as lighting is fine. But the plot, characters and dialogue is not good in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: Dear Melissa McCarthy, can you stop working with your husband?
reviews.content: Look, Ben Falcone and Melissa McCarthy are probably a very happy couple, but they need to STOP making movies together. This genuinely has a shot of being the worst movie of the year. It's a lot of things, but not good. If I have to name some positives, the chemistry between Spencer and McCarthy is sweet and makes their scenes at least watchable. The actors in general give solid performances and make the best out of a horrible script. It's just so sad to see great actors like McCarthy, Spencer and Bateman be in such an awful movie, because they are fantastic actors. Everything except the acting performances, is bad. The dialogue is so dreadfully bad, that there are scenes that are just unwatchable. The Taser felt like a non-playable character in a video game that just shouts the same ten lines over and over again. The script in general is just not good at all. There are scenes where am just wondering: "What the hell is the director thinking?" I don't want to watch Melissa McCarthy stuff raw chicken in her mouth. It made me want to trow up honestly. But I can put all that aside, if it is funny, because it's comedy after all. But the jokes are so generic and recycled, that I could probably go the nearest comedy club and watch some dude tell dad jokes, because those are more original. I just feel bad for the great actors that can do so much better, because this will leave a big stain on their careers, except McCarthy, who just needs to stop working with her husband.

I'm giving this four stars. To me, it's a mindless feel-good movie. It's not really super entertaining, but it's not so terribly horrible. There are some good chuckle moments, but not much else. Emily's character fell completely flat, though, and her daughter's character felt like I was watching one of those silly Nickelodeon sitcoms with the weird, terrible teen acting.
Except for Jason Bateman, everything in this movie is lame, boring, dumb and very, very bad written.

So many bad reviews from armchair critics that are expecting a 400 million dollar Marvel movie. It is a low budget comedy spoof that is not meant to be great. Brainless fun. Yes, the actors are capable of much better performances, but Bateman as a crab is just the best thing.
I mean it's not Marvel or even DC but it's a fun watch. I laughed a lot watching this. If u go into this movie with no expectations it's pretty good. Idk why there r a lot of negitive.reviews.
Cancel Netflix, Rip Off. I supported them from so long ago, not they just show junk.
Not sure why this has had such bad reviews. There's a lot of silliness but also some wittier moments. Great cast. Good effects. Easy and fun to watch.

I gave it a five only for the beginning of the movie. I love both Melissa McCarthy and Octavia Spencer. In fact I am shocked Octavia did such a horrible movie. As a person who is not a size zero. I am getting a little upset on how Melissa McCarthy portrays women of size. It's embarrassing. She mostly portrays as uncouth and gross sense of humor. While I don't usually care about swearing she just does it in times it's not called for. Even if you weren't raised in the best situation her character was around others with manners (for the love of god) pickup so social cures. I did like how the story started out with the girls young. I had hope. Then it just went to gross humor and predictable screw ups. I just wanted this to be good. I was disappointed..

reviews.review_title: Watched Literally the First Movie We Saw
reviews.content: The world was struck by solar radiation in the early 80s, resulting in superpowers manifesting worldwide exclusively in the hands of sociopaths. That left the world rampant in supervillains, but without any superheroes to keep them in check. Enter Emily Stanton who lost her parents to a Miscreant attack, and has made it her life's mission to create superheroes to fight back against them. Unfortunately her childhood best friend Lydia has a talent for getting in the way and messing everything up, and ends up accidentally injecting herself with the serum that gives super strength, making her the world's first superhero. And so Thunder Force was born, with Lydia taking the mantle of Hammer, and Emily taking the mantle of Bingo after taking a few pills to turn herself invisible. The plot is absolutely nothing to shout about. Act one; here's Lydia and Emily as they grow up together and grow apart as adults. Act two; Lydia takes the serum and starts her training to be a superhero. Act three; they go and thwart evil Canavale's plans. Credits. There's some vague attempts at plot twists, but they're so painfully predictable I managed to call out every single one super early on.Like almost every other Melissa McCarthy comedy vehicle, this is the Melissa McCarthy show. It's all about her character Lydia as she bursts in and pushes every other supporting character to the sidelines, which is a shame because there's some real acting talent here that ends up wasted on hollow characters. Octavia Spencer is the biggest victim. While she should by all rights be equal partner in the movie, she spends her civilian scenes with a perpetually disappointed expression, and her heroic scenes just standing there waiting for something to do. But she's not alone. The chameleonic Melissa Leo has a few minutes screen time as a senior Stanton employee who acts as their guide, but all she's given is to play the grumpy strict one. Bobby Canavale is a fantastic actor who has a habit of choosing awful movies with shallow roles, and this is no exception. Hey, Bobby, just play the villain as a bumbling yet evil idiot. Sure thing. In fact the only actors who really make much of an impression at all are half-creant Jason Bateman who's constantly Zoidberging out of shot, and the young actresses that somehow manage to perfectly encapsulate McCarthy's typical on-screen personality (which is no surprise considering one of them is McCarthy's actual daughter, so go figure). And then there's Taylor Mosby who gets altogether too much screen time.But to be fair, this is a comedy, so as long as it makes you laugh it's worth watching right? Thunder Force, I'll admit, did give me a few hearty chuckles. It wasn't exactly laugh-a-minute, and the jokes here are not exactly the most high brow around, mostly focussing on McCarthy's ability to ad-lib on the spot, but there are some great moments here. Every time Bateman's Crab hands are on the screen is enough to earn a few laughs, especially the crab-crawling away from fights every time, and while the eating of raw chicken goes on too long and is repeated too often, it also offers some humorous moments. In all, it's just dumb fun. If you're too snobbish for some casual, dumb fun then you won't find this remotely amusing.One thing I think this movie does deserve some kudos for though is representation. The superhero/comic-book community has a hard-on for representation and Thunder Force is some of the best representation you could ask for. Every superhero in this movie is female, with realistic body shapes, and obviously Emily is black to boot. So we've got gender, race, and age covered. Of course the film doesn't exactly play this angle completely seriously, often using McCarthy and Spencer's age and body weight as the butt of a few jokes, but hey, got to start somewhere eh?Other than that, this film feels like it was made for the 90s, with a very outdated viewpoint of superheroes and comic books present from its opening scenes. Other than the level of technology and near-constant references to Fortnite (seriously Mel, stop flossing, you look like a middle-aged woman trying desperately to be cool), you could've told me this movie was twenty-five years old and I'd have believed you. It has more in common with Batman & Robin than more modern superhero affairs, like it was made by Gen-X'ers based on what they think superhero movies are like, and taking the piss out of them. If you want a decent superhero comedy, look almost anywhere else. If you want a decent McCarthy vehicle, Thunder Force will not offer anything different to any other out there. If you want some background noise that might make you laugh every now and then, well have I got the recommendation for you! I give Thunder Force a particularly not-great 4/10. It almost falls into the category of so bad it's good, just enough to be enjoyable enough despite its plot holes, but doesn't quite hit the absolute best of the worst to make that a legitimate assessment. For many, this is just bad.

reviews.review_title: A funny and wonderful film that differs from the classic supes
reviews.content: The endless critique is so obviously focused on the fact that these talented don't look like stereotypes for these kinds of movies. As well as none of them are big names in gossip too. I loved the fact that they didn't make a thing about their appearance (even though they both are absolutely gorgeous) or their age. They simply kick *ss! This movie is funny, singular and great entertainment! Octavia and Melissa are amazing as always giving good dimensions to characters who could've fallen flat without their superb talents! I laughed til I cried and I thoroughly enjoyed the film! Can't wait til I can rewatch it!

I was forced to watch this with a girl this evening. I barely made it through alive. This movie has basically no redeeming qualities whatsoever. The story is contrived, simple and still unbelievable. The acting is atrocious and overdone. The stunts appear to be intentionally poorly done and the CGI is subpar.The two main characters are crude and crass and the only joke you are going to get is about food or falling down or how fat they are and the food made me fart and I fell down! There is literally a scene of one of them eating breakfast for over sixty seconds with no break just to prove a point. They're fat! And rude! Funny isn't it? We got stuck in a lamborghini because we're sooooo fat!This is Avengers mixed with Paul Blart Mall Cop with about sixty tubs of fat acceptance mayonnaise plopped on top.This movie serves as an attempt to prove that even insufferably crude morbidly obese women can make awful movies!

reviews.review_title: A film that seems to decide more on sentimental comedy than parody and loses.
reviews.content: SummaryFailed comedy with Melissa McCarthy and a reluctant Octavia Spencer as two designer superheroes. Some really very funny scenes are half lost, like loose, in a movie that seems to decide more on sentimental comedy than parody and loses.ReviewA cosmic radiation turns some human beings into evildoers with certain powers. Years later, a scientist and a childhood friend meet again and by accident end up forming a squad of superheroines who face a candidate for mayor of Chicago.Melisa McCarthy and her husband Ben Falcone (director and screenwriter) are an artistic duo with several titles to their credit, based on the charisma and undoubted grace of the former.In this case, Thunder Force looks like a collage of two different films that do not finish combining: a sentimental comedy about the reunion of two friends (one successful, the scientist Emily, by Octavia Spencer, and the other not so much, Lydia, played by McCarthy) and a parodic comedy about two obese designer superheroines (close in style to the marvelous Spy, also starring McCarthy but directed by Paul Feig),. It is as if there is an indecision on the part of the director between filming a serious movie about superheroes or a parody about them (a synthesis that Shazam! Can achieve, for example).But the "serious" part is quite anodyne and one is left, instead wishing for more funny moments, which there are and a lot. The action scenes and their special effects are also achieved.Contributing to the overall result is the performance of Octavia Spencer, who maintains the same listless register throughout the film, with little chemistry with her coequiper; as if comedy wasn't his thing. On the other hand, the scenes with Jason Batman, which exudes chemistry and grace, are not wasted.

This will probably depend on your sense of humour and whether you're a fan of Melissa McCarthy, but I found it pretty darn funny especially the scenes with McCarthy and Bateman. They have a good comedic chemistry going on. Unlike her and Olivia Spencer though... She did terrible! Basically sucked the life out of the funny scenes. I had to keep focusing on McCarthy in their scenes together to overcome this torture. Even her younger version of her character did way better than her. Maybe comedy is not her thing. Should've casted somebody else.

One far out film just making fun of superhero movies. Just a Fun well done movie that is a blast to watch. As an art form films are made by multiple artist and should evaluated as such, especially Indie films. I recommend that you give it a watch.
Love stupid comedies and this movie fits that description. Corny humour but I sill enjoyed it. It lifted my mood.and made me smile.

This is really bad, the storyline is bad, the action are bad. What they explained before did not came out, and they did not explain the reason for the 2 kind of diet.Also, I miss information about why the suit could not be washed. How it rolled in was good but not great, took way too long of time. It took way too long before the real story comes. What is it with the different characters did not explained. It is all over the place, but nothing real happening.Acting is oke, but the script is bad, like the humorist moments are really bad, totally not to laugh. What I do need to say is that most are innovative ones, also some moments and elements are innovative, makes it oke.I would say watch it if you do not have anything to do, think about Sunday afternoon after a nice lunch or walk with your children or girlfriend, want some girl power.
A good movie. Entertaining and funny but, the elements of this movie are just typiska so to say, some of us are inherently evil apparently. Slow applauds are given for effort but not for result.

The movie isn't exactly expanding the genre of superhero movies... but there were a few choice moments. Is it incredibly predictable? Yes. Is it going to win awards? No. But with a name like Thunder Force... you shouldn't expect too much. Just watch Melissa do her thing.. and don't think about it.
If you ever see them in the cast, save yourself from the expense and find something else to watch. Wanna cancel my subscription to Netflix after watching this trash.
Don't waste your time with this garbage, is just bad !!!!

reviews.review_title: A fun movie to make you forget your troubles
reviews.content: Is it the best Melissa McCarthy movie? No. Is it still fun and entertaining? Yes. I enjoyed it. Everyone needs to stop being so negative. Give it a try!

reviews.review_title: kinda like Spinal Tap, in a weird way
reviews.content: If you are familiar with the far better film called Spinal Tap, in that film, the titular band Spinal Tap releases an album called Shark Sandwich.The reviews for that album call it .. a variation of the same title.The very same definition applies here.Thunder Force is a film whose title is the only vaguely decent thing about it. Melissa McCarthy and Octavia Spencer start in this pathetic "superhero" version of, what is essentially the same humor as the new Ghostbuster had, but now with added "action".Terrible. Just terrible. These people are not funny. This style of comedy is not funny. Stop trying to make something not funny thinking you can beat us over the head with it. This film has a rating of 4.4/10 CAN WE STOP USING THIS FORMAT PLEASE.
Not funny or interesting. Not worth your time watching, i am not sure why it has been made.

reviews.review_title: The perfect answer for all the Marvel and DC trite
reviews.content: Reading the reviews for this is pretty funny. People saying it's pure garbage, awful, and on and on. I guess they missed the point of it. Normally I can't stand comedies but this thing had me laughing many times - and that's a good thing. It wasn't try-hard comedy either as you typically get with comedies - it's funny because it's just absurd, and that's the entire point of the movie. I'd take this any day over the never ending trash coming out of Disney and now the DC stuff.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says
reviews.content: Its not a great movie by any stretch. But its a decent comedy with some stupid but funny humor. So if you have spare time and are into that stuff, its worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Woke-A-Mania Running Wild..Typical Melissa McCarthy Crap.
reviews.content: I thought after seeing 'The Kitchen' that Melissa McCarthy movies hit an all time low. I was wrong. 'Thunder Force' is now the pinnacle of that trash heap.Great production values and good sound track. That is why I gave 2 stars.The new WO-MAN of our times. She can't find any good female roles to play? She needs to play a male stereotype still ?? But shes making bank. So that's important.

Melissa McCarthy and Octavia Spenser looked like they had a blast with this film! Great action sequences, typical comedy for a movie with Melissa McCarthy in it. The special effects were very well done and the story isn't bad!!! Actually hoping for a sequel!
There's absolutely nothing wrong with this movie, no its not a blockbuster but just as good as any other made for the small screen flick.Enjoyed it!
Disappointing garbage. That's the nicest thing I can say. Oy vey.

reviews.review_title: Pretty funny, don't take it too seriously.
reviews.content: I get the impression that a lot of reviews are from people who wouldn't usually watch this sort of movie, this is fine but please don't feel you have to review everything!This film has its place and is silly and fun, the cast is good and they get the most of a mediocre script. I enjoyed it but don't take it too seriously!

I'm surprised at the number of poor reviews of this movie. It was exactly what I expected it to be: goofy, funny and not to be taken seriously. I think the bottom line on this is if you like Melissa McCarthy and Jason Bateman, you'll enjoy this; if you don't, this probably isn't the movie for you.

Let's be real, sometimes all you need is a senseless movie. Is it Oscar worthy? No. But it's not "terrible" it has humor, heart and the classic Melissa and Ben duo. It is a good passing the time movie. Not terrible but not fantastic watch-again type movie either. Good one and done scenario if I'm completely honest.
This movie is great! Anything Ben Falcon does I love. It's entertaining and silly. Jason Bateman always has a place in my heart.

McCarthy has funny films that have a typical formula that make them funny, usually starting with a script written by people who get the comedy genre and then a director paired with an editor that understand timing and delivery. This film doesn't have that formula. The reviews that say 10/10 should be required to answer a real "why" question in order to be visible by others.My "why" for a 2/10: falls flat on many scenes that could have been funny if the right lead was cast. McCarthy as a dumb but strong character paired with a woman that seems to lack any and all comic ability definitely delivers as is. That is- it doesn't. Spencer is a great actress. We have seen her delivery in dramas. It makes no sense in this case when really all we needed as a humorous lead allowing McCarthy to be the comic relief she's good at as a supporting character or one that can be trashed and get laughs.A quick search for "Spy" is a good resume for McCarthy's success. Or even brides maids. Both roles she acted as a side kick to someone even more ridiculous than here. Spencer doesn't do it.

reviews.review_title: Thunder Force More Like Thunder Thud
reviews.content: Melissa McCarthy is becoming the David Schwimmer (Friends) of actors, they are the same character in everything they are in. I won't drag this review out and say how mediocre I think the acting was or how I think Director and writer Ben Falcone should stick to acting. I will simply say if you are looking to shut your brain pan off for an hour and 46 minutes, you could do worse that Thunder Force. McCarthy should go back to TV and Octavia please be a bit more selective. There were a few funny lines but overall, the usual Melissa McCarthy humor. On a side note I had nacho's and the crunching made some of the dialog incoherent so I had that going for me.If you like Melisa McCarthy watch Identity Thief, She and Jason Bateman will keep you laughing in that one.
This is plain silly on purpose but a few good gags and good performances make this a watchable comedy. A bit predictable but not the worst thing you will ever see.

reviews.review_title: BEWARE...Don't be duped by the trailer. Terrible.
reviews.content: If you watch the trailer you might think you got a kinda silly, funny super hero buddy comedy here, why not give it a shot? And then an hour & forty five minutes later, you'll be shaking your head. Holy moly, just horrible, terrible. You've been warned & way too many things wrong with the movie to try & list, just take mine (& many others) word for it, pick something else....

reviews.review_title: Liked the Idea but Not the Execution
reviews.content: The minute we heard this was out we watched it that evening...and, didn't make it past an hour. Other than a few of McCartney's ad-lib zingers, there is literally nothing here. Bateman is kind of funny, but, he's not much a part of this. I've only ever seen Octavia in serious roles, and maybe that's where she belongs. An immediate thought was, "Why wasn't this Maya Rudolph?" Kirsten Wiig made sense, Monique, Tiffany Haddish - would have been great except the age difference. It would be like if they used Merle Streep in Heat instead of Sandra Bullock. Two funny women bantering back and forth could have at least made the weak script more palatable.The script I've seen a million times, and, like, 1/3 of the film is them training to be superheroes. I mean, it just kept going on, and on, and on. Training is a 5-10 minute montage of scenes, tops. And, now that I think of it, there was no plot, simply cause and effect.I'm not sure how the script got approved. My friend is producing a show there and hers sounds so micromanaged, which makes me wonder how Thunder Force got such a loosey goosey production. Maybe they bought it with a simple pitch, realized once the product was delivered, knew it was going to tank and just sort of squeezed it out? I don't know. It's a shame. Two great talents and an interesting concept put to waste. I mean, again, not exactly a rocket-science concept, but could have been at least fun.

reviews.review_title: was waiting for the ending credits to roll by so I can get out of there
reviews.content: This literally has to be the worst movie ever made. Written and Directed by McCarthy's husband!Now I know for sure Rebel Wilson is funnier and classier than Melissa.Even John Candy and Drew Carey would have done a better job. The only two redeeming actors of the movie are. Jason Bateman and Bobby Cannavale.All three superheroes are an embarassment to the movie business. Do not waste your time watching this movie.

reviews.review_title: Half-baked and Lackluster Superhero Parody That Wastes Melissa McCarthy's Comedic Talents
reviews.content: Thunder Force, Melissa McCarty's latest superhero parody from Netflix, is a half-baked and lackluster comedy that wastes its two stars with jokes that are a decade off sync with the current comic book trend.Melissa McCarthy is a talented comedic actress who is quick-witted, has great timing and an unpredictable manic energy. Her talents doesn't work by itself though. They require a capable comedy director to shape and mold her performance onscreen in context to the story at hand.While Octavia Spencer and Melissa McCarthy do make an interesting pairing as onscreen friends, there's no comedic energy crackling between them at all. Spencer plays her role too straight as if she was in a completely different dramatic movie and is never given the opportunity to fire back and comedically banter with McCarthy.Ben Falcone, Melissa McCarthy's husband who previously directed her in the mediocre Life of the Party and The Boss, is no Paul Feig. Feig knows how to fish for jokes on set through improvisation and has the discipline to chisel them down in the editing room. He knows how to time a joke and kept a comedic energy bouncing along between the scenes while moving the story forward.There are immense gaps of boredom in Thunder Force. The story takes a long time to get set up and drones on from the middle onward. Occasionally, a gag will come. Funny or not, it is not enough to bring the energy back up. We are just slowly moving forward through the plot beats.As a parody, the script does not have a clear goal what exactly it wants to poke fun at with the superhero genre. Is the notion of superpowers ridiculous? Or is it having so much power? Are we watching what Melissa McCarthy would do with superpowers? The film does not know.It's just not funny enough. Skip this one.

Getting way too much hate when is is a fun, easy watch! I'm a Melissa McCarthy fan, but even for me a lot of her movies try too hard for jokes that don't land-this movie, however, tried just enough and landed each time. You couldn't ask for a better co-star than Octavia Spencer,but I wish she had more fun with it, hence the star deduction. I watched it for the first time with my 60 yr old mother and we both really enjoyed it, and it went on our short list of we-are-happy-to-watch-repeatedly list. Props to Falcone as well, you can see his evolution as a director!

reviews.review_title: Watch for the cast, plus Batema/McCarthy.
reviews.content: This is a superhero "almost" parody. It's not trying to deliver a message or be anything it's not. It's not trying to give social commentary. It's just fun with an excellent cast. That being said, the scenes with Bateman and McCarthy are hilarious. As campy funny as it gets. The rest is just Netflix silliness.

If you like Melissa McCarthy then you'll probably like the film. My issues have nothing to do with the actors, it's the writing. The writing is awful at times, but good at certain times. The beginning of the film was somewhat okay. You see something that I've barely seen in films, teachers telling bullies off immediately. Might seem like a small thing, but I really liked that.I really liked the actor who played Emily's grandmother, she was great throughout the film. Pom Klementieff was also pretty good in the film. Octavia Spencer did what she could with what was in the script, and Melissa McCarthy is Melissa McCarthy, and if you like that then you'll enjoy some parts of the film.I truly have no idea how Ben Falcone gets his films greenlit. And I truly have no idea why Melissa McCarthy keeps taking the job, she's so much better than what her husband gives her to work with.
Now replace my wording with profanity!"lets make a bad movie" Says the someone!!Everyone agrees and this comes out!

I do not claim than Melissa McCarthy is my favorite artists - but I watched couple of movies where I enjoyed her acting.Then came "Ghostbusters" - which was one of the least funny attempts at comedy I have watched. Now - this one. It was even worse.Newsflash - comedy must be funny! It may be low-level (like Adam Sandlers flicks, that I was avoiding lately), but funny it should be. It was not even remotely funny.

reviews.review_title: When the end credits are the most entertaining part of a movie..
reviews.content: A comedy devoid of comedy. Doubtful even a bad movie drinking game could make make this film a fun time.

Movie had a good plot - superheros who no can conceive to be one (females + approaching 50s + not supermodel figured) - that is why I even gave it a try. SUPER was just disappointment - movie was bad at acting, humor, deliveries. Only breather was presence of Jason Bateman still not enough to suffer the time on it.Save yourself - I wasn't wise enough to.

My rating of 3 might be generous for this one, but that's primarily for Jason Bateman. His crab character is the only entertaining character in the film. The plot sounded interesting enough and it had the potential to be really funny, but unfortunately the writing was just plain bad. I mean, in one scene the girl villain literally says 'Wee...' while using her powers. That being said, I actually did enjoy the dynamic between Jason and Melissa's characters. Yes, the plot is not very original, but that's not really the problem here in my opinion. It's such a disappointment, they had Melissa McCarthy, Octavia Spencer and Jason Bateman in the same film, it could've been awesome. The actors do their best with what's in the script. This could've been really good, if they had gotten a better writer.

Unfunny, forced (pun inteded, and it's funnier than any joke in the movie), if you saw one Melissa McCarthy movie, ever, you saw them all. Same character, same "jokes". If that's your cup of tea, go for it, you'll probably enjoy this movie too. If you would just watch it because for some reason it's trending on netflix, don't. Not worth it.

Octavia Spencer has multiple nominations for awards, including three Oscars, and one of her great strengths is how she projects warmth and a personal connection to those around her with her portrayals. There's none of that here.I get that she's playing a super smart scientist - Emily Stanton - who's dedicated her life to dealing with a group of super bad guys who killed her parents - as shown in the first section of the film as she grows up with her seemingly only friend Lydia Berman, while everyone else thinks she's a nerd - yet having grown apart and then reuniting, there is practically no extremes of emotion in her reactions. She's like a robot compared to McCarthys unpredictable toddler.I used to really enjoy watching McCarthy in Mike and Molly, where she played an grown up woman, and Heat, where she could really bounce off the straight laced Sandra Bullock, but sadly they haven't recreated that chemistry here. It's a good cast, but they haven't been given much to work with.
I don't understand who green lights movies like these. Some can be fun, but this is just ridiculous. Seems like aren't even trying anymore. What a waste!
